intro: Ophthalmacanthus gemmiparus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that produce numerous offsets through vegetative propagation. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil with indirect light. Ophthalmacanthus gemmiparus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
